page.title: 12CRAFT FAYRE AT ARBURY HALL
page.content: Lucy King,aged seven,visited a craft fayre at Arbury Hall.The hall is on the Arbury estate on the outskirts of Nuneaton.It is open for the public to look round at certain times of the year.You enter through the main gate called "Round Towers" in Stoskingford. "The stalls were in a tent in the beautiful garden.All the people selling goods were dressed up as if they lived in olden times.People were selling pictures and sweets.A man sold stones that were painted with cottages.I bought a head band with a butterfly on the side.Mummy talked to a lady making earrings out of beads.My sister bought some bees wax.I liked watching the lady making pictures from dried flowers and the man writing on glass.A lot of men in uniform were looking after the house and garden."
